Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that has water and is healthy.
The student can draw a plant that does not have water and is wilting or unhealthy.
The student can show the difference in the drawings between a plant with water and a plant without water.
The student can label the drawings to show which plant has water and which does not.
The student can draw or describe the importance of water for plant growth and survival in the drawing.
